ReversiController

Class ReversiController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ReversiController.ReversiController

  • public class ReversiController
extends java.lang.Object
    File: ReversiController.java Modifies the user input for the model and also contains logic for checker replacement.
    Author:
    Andrew Raftovich araftovich@email.arizona.edu, Benhur Tadiparti tadiparti@email.arizona.edu

      • humanTurn

        public void humanTurn(int row,
                      int col)
        When the user clicks a spot on the board, if it is their turn, update the board with checker placement.
        Parameters:
        row - the horizontal position of the checker.
        col - the vertical position of the checker.

      • sendData

        Sends data to a Server/Client
        Throws:

      • setNetwork

        public void setNetwork(int port,
                       java.lang.String host,
                       boolean isServer,
                       boolean isHuman)
        Creates a network connection to a Server or Client
        Parameters:
        port - Number that the host is using.
        host - Address for the host.
        isServer - If the connection is a server or client connection.
        isHuman - If the connector is either a human or robot.

      • endConnection

        public void endConnection()
        Ends connection with a Server/Client

      • isValidPosition

        private boolean isValidPosition(int row,
                                int col)
        Checks if the checker placement on the board is near an opposing color/Valid position.
        Parameters:
        row - the horizontal position of the checker.
        col - the vertical position of the checker.
        Returns:
        If the checker placement is valid.

      • validMoveOrFlip

        private java.lang.Boolean validMoveOrFlip(int row,
                                          int col,
                                          char type,
                                          char player)
        Checks to see if this is a valid move, meaning that at least one token of the opponents team will be swapped, or flips tokens to match token that was placed.
        Parameters:
        row - the horizontal position of the checker.
        col - the vertical position of the checker.
        Returns:
        true if and only if there are tokens that can be turned or have been turned.
